Anny on

Class: Network

Network

A Network contains Layers of Neurons.

Constructor

new Network(layerSizes)

Creates a Network of Layers consisting of Neurons. Each array element indicates a layer. The value indicates the number of Neurons in that Layer.

The first element represents the number of Neurons in the input Layer. The last element represents the number of Neurons in the output Layer. Each element in between represents a hidden Layer with n Neurons.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
layerSizes Array.<number>

Number of neurons in each layer.
Source:
  • Network.js, line 22
Examples
// 2 inputs
// 1 output
const net = new Network([2, 1]);
// 16 inputs
// 10 neuron hidden layer
// 4 neuron hidden layer
// 1 output
const net = new Network([16, 10, 4, 1]);

Members

allLayers :Layer

An array of all Layers in the Network.

An array of all Layers in the Network. It is a single dimension array containing the inputLayer, hiddenLayers, and the outputLayer.

Type:
  • Layer
Source:
  • Network.js, line 75

error :null|number

The result of the errorFn.

The result of the errorFn. Initializes as null.

Type:
  • null | number
Source:
  • Network.js, line 68

errorFn :ERROR

The cost function.

The cost function. The function used to calculate the error of the Network. In other words, to what degree was the Network's output wrong.

Type:
  • ERROR
Source:
  • Network.js, line 62
See:
  • ERROR

hiddenLayers :Array.<Layer>

An array of all layers between the inputLayer and outputLayer.

An array of all layers between the inputLayer and outputLayer.

Type:
  • Array.<Layer>
Source:
  • Network.js, line 87

inputLayer :Layer

The first Layer of the Network.

The first Layer of the Network. This Layer receives input during activation.

Type:
  • Layer
Source:
  • Network.js, line 81

output :Array

The output values of the Neurons in the last layer.

The output values of the Neurons in the last layer. This is identical to the Network's outputLayer output.

Type:
  • Array
Source:
  • Network.js, line 54

outputLayer :Layer

The last Layer of the Network.

The last Layer of the Network. The output of this Layer is the "prediction" the Network has made for some given input.

Type:
  • Layer
Source:
  • Network.js, line 94

Methods

activate(inputs) → {Array.<number>}

Activate the network with a given set of input values.

Activate the network with a given set of input values.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
inputs Array.<number>

Values to activate the Network input Neurons. Values should be normalized between -1 and 1 using Util.normalize.

output values

Array.<number>

correct(output)

Correct the Network to produce the specified output.

Correct the Network to produce the specified output.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
output Array.<number>

The target output for the Network. Values in the array specify the target output of the Neuron in the output layer.
Source:
  • Network.js, line 122

train(data, optionsopt)

Train the Network to produce the output from the given input.

Train the Network to produce the output from the given input.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
data Array.<object>

Array of objects in the form {input: [], output: []}.
options Object <optional>

Training options.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Default Description
errorThreshold number <optional>
 0.001

The target error value. The goal of the Network is to train until the error is below this value.
frequency number <optional>

How many iterations through the training data between calling options.onProgress.
maxEpochs number <optional>
 20000

The max training iterations. The Network will stop training after iterating through the training data this number of times. One full loop through the training data is counted as one epoch.
onFail Network~onFail <optional>

Called if the Network error does not fall below the errorThreshold after maxEpochs.
onProgress Network~onProgress <optional>

Called every frequency epochs.
onSuccess Network~onSuccess <optional>

Called if the Network error falls below the errorThreshold during training.
Source:
  • Network.js, line 154

Type Definitions

onFail(error, epoch)

Called if the Network error is not below the errorThreshold after maxEpochs iterations through the training data set.

Called if the Network error is not below the errorThreshold after maxEpochs iterations through the training data set.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
error number

The Network error value at the time of success.
epoch number

Indicates on which iteration through the training data the Network became successful.
